awd_titl_txt: FSML:Request to Improve Seawater System at OIMB
awd_abstract_narration: The Oregon Institute of Marine Biology (OIMB) conducts  research and offers courses on the biology  of marine organisms.  Resident and visiting faculty,  postdoctoral associates, graduate students, and  undergraduates use the teaching and research laboratories  year round.    A seawater water system is essential to the function of a  marine station such as OIMB; it permits  researchers and instructors to work with live organisms.  Currently any growth in the OIMB programs  is limited by the amount of seawater that can be stored for  use in the teaching and research labs, and the  amount of wet laboratory space available for research  activities.  In this project OIMB will construct a 480  square foot wet lab annex to house new seawater tables space  and incubators, and a 30,000 gallon concrete seawater  storage tank.  This would allow an almost doubling of the  amount of seawater that could be stored, thus permitting an  expansion of research and teaching activities.  It would  also provide additional seawater table space in an aquarium  annex to be built adjacent to the research building.
